nextActions.title: The 3 things you should do next
nextActions.subtitle: Three practical moves you can do this week.
nextActions.helperLine: ðŸ‘‰ These three actions most directly affect your growth in the next 30 days.

1.title: ðŸ‘‰ Pick one weekly theme
1.desc: Choose one repeatable topic and publish it twice this week.

2.title: ðŸ‘‰ Improve your hook
2.desc: Rewrite the first line to be specific and audience-first.

3.title: ðŸ‘‰ Copy what already works
3.desc: Turn your best post into a 3-part mini series with the same angle.

1.title: ðŸ‘‰ Lock a posting cadence
1.desc: Aim for 2 posts this week with the same topic and format.

2.title: ðŸ‘‰ Clarify your niche
2.desc: Write one sentence: who you help + what you share + why it matters.

3.title: ðŸ‘‰ Plan your next 10 posts
3.desc: Draft 10 titles in one sitting so you never run out of ideas.

1.title: ðŸ‘‰ Build a signature series
1.desc: Pick one format and run it 3 times with a consistent message.

2.title: ðŸ‘‰ Tighten your profile
2.desc: Make your bio and pinned posts say exactly what youâ€™re about.

3.title: ðŸ‘‰ Create your content angles
3.desc: Define 5 angles you want to be known for, then rotate them.

1.title: ðŸ‘‰ Ask one clear question
1.desc: End every post with a simple question that invites replies.

2.title: ðŸ‘‰ Turn comments into content
2.desc: Pick one common comment and answer it as your next post.

3.title: ðŸ‘‰ Build a reply script
3.desc: Prepare quick reply templates to keep conversations flowing.

1.title: ðŸ‘‰ Start a weekly ritual
1.desc: Run a weekly prompt so your community expects to participate.

2.title: ðŸ‘‰ Feature your audience
2.desc: Share 1 follower story or comment and respond with your take.

3.title: ðŸ‘‰ Map your community topics
3.desc: List 8 discussion topics your audience loves and recycle them.

1.title: ðŸ‘‰ Write a clear offer
1.desc: Describe what you do in one line and who itâ€™s for.

2.title: ðŸ‘‰ Add one proof post
2.desc: Post a short case study: problem â†’ process â†’ result.

3.title: ðŸ‘‰ Set an inquiry path
3.desc: Decide where inquiries go (DM or form) and mention it consistently.

1.title: ðŸ‘‰ Package 3 collaboration ideas
1.desc: Write 3 brand-safe content ideas you can deliver this month.

2.title: ðŸ‘‰ Create a media kit outline
2.desc: Summarize your niche, audience, and top posts in one page.

3.title: ðŸ‘‰ Draft your pitch message
3.desc: Prepare a short pitch you can send to brands in under 30 seconds.

1.title: ðŸ‘‰ Systemize your workflow
1.desc: Batch create: outline 5 posts today, film tomorrow, edit next.

2.title: ðŸ‘‰ Double down on winners
2.desc: Repeat your top-performing format with a new angle.

3.title: ðŸ‘‰ Plan your content calendar
3.desc: Build a simple 2-week calendar so your output stays consistent.

1.title: ðŸ‘‰ Choose one monetization path
1.desc: Pick one offer to focus on this month (service, product, or affiliate).

2.title: ðŸ‘‰ Create a simple CTA
2.desc: Add one consistent call-to-action in your posts and bio.

3.title: ðŸ‘‰ Build a conversion post
3.desc: Write one post that explains the problem and your solution clearly.

description.growthStage: Youâ€™re building your base. Focus on consistency and a clear topic so new people know why to follow.

description.stableCreator: Youâ€™re showing up consistently with solid engagement. Keep your cadence and scale whatâ€™s working.
description.clientReady: People are replying and talking with you. You can start turning attention into leads with a clear offer.
description.brandCollaboration: You have both scale and strong engagement. Youâ€™re in a great spot to pitch and land brand partnerships.

followers.title: Followers

engagementRate.description: Keep whatâ€™s working and simplify your message so more people engage faster.

avgComments.title: Avg Comments

engagementVolume.title: Engagement Volume
engagementVolume.description: Double down on your best angle and post it again with a fresh hook.

consequence.followers: If this stays flat, growth will feel slow even when you post more.
consequence.engagementRate: If this stays the same, reach tends to plateau because signals stay weak.
consequence.avgLikes: If this stays low, new viewers wonâ€™t get a clear reason to follow.
consequence.avgComments: If this stays low, youâ€™ll get fewer warm conversations and DMs.
consequence.engagementVolume: If this stays flat, your best posts wonâ€™t compound over time.
consequence.postsPerWeek: If this stays inconsistent, itâ€™s harder for people (and algorithms) to expect you.

goals.title: What's your current goal?

growFollowers.role: This metric helps you estimate whether your content earns reactions that lead to follow intent.
growFollowers.status: Your current performance suggests a stable foundation, with room to improve consistency.
growFollowers.action: Next step: repeat one high-performing format weekly and tighten the first line hook.

increaseLikes.role: This metric shows whether your posts reliably earn lightweight positive feedback.
increaseLikes.status: Your current performance looks steady, with opportunities to sharpen what resonates.
increaseLikes.action: Next step: test two visual-first formats and keep the best one for the next 5 posts.

increaseComments.role: This metric reflects how often your content triggers conversation, not just quick reactions.
increaseComments.status: Your current performance indicates engagement is present, but discussion could deepen.
increaseComments.action: Next step: add a specific question or a two-choice prompt and pin the best reply.

boostReach.role: This metric helps you track whether you are giving the algorithm enough consistent opportunities to distribute.
boostReach.status: Your current performance appears workable, but reach typically improves with steadier cadence.
boostReach.action: Next step: set a fixed weekly schedule and maintain it for two cycles before adjusting.

buildPersonalBrand.role: This metric indicates whether your content earns trust and relevance signals from the audience.
buildPersonalBrand.status: Your current performance suggests you have a base signal, but messaging clarity can improve.
buildPersonalBrand.action: Next step: keep one consistent point of view and repeat it across a three-post series.

getBrandDeals.role: This metric is a proxy for audience quality and how strongly your content holds attention.
getBrandDeals.status: Your current performance shows a reasonable baseline, with room to improve signal strength.
getBrandDeals.action: Next step: publish one case-study style post and track which angle gets the most responses.

becomeCreator.role: This metric reflects whether your publishing system is consistent enough to learn and iterate.
becomeCreator.status: Your current performance looks sustainable, but consistency is the main lever to strengthen.
becomeCreator.action: Next step: lock a repeatable weekly rhythm and batch-produce your next weekâ€™s posts.

monetizeConsistently.role: This metric helps you validate whether attention translates into meaningful interest over time.
monetizeConsistently.status: Your current performance shows early signals, but outcomes benefit from a clearer offer narrative.
monetizeConsistently.action: Next step: add one clear call-to-action in a weekly post and keep it consistent for a month.

instagram.connectPromptTitle: Connect Instagram to load real data
instagram.connectPromptDesc: Authorize Instagram to replace demo data with your real profile and recent posts.

connectGate.title: Connect Instagram
connectGate.desc: Connect your Instagram account to load real data and view analysis.

missingEnv.title: Environment variables not set
missingEnv.desc: OAuth is not configured. Please set these env vars:
missingEnv.restartHint: After setting them, restart the dev server (npm run dev).

badges.modeHint: A = inferred / estimated. C = official / connected.
badges.inferredDesc: is an estimate from visible signals. Official (C) requires a connected account.

overview.threadsNote: Threads-related insights are inferred from content cadence and engagement overlap signals.

insights.whyThisMatters: Why this matters: these signals affect reach, saves, and your ability to repeat what works.
insights.proHint: ðŸ”’ Detailed explanation & actionable breakdown in Pro

0.title: Strong Engagement Rate
0.description: You're already outperforming the baselineâ€”your audience consistently reacts to your content. Next: pick 1â€“2 winning formats and repeat them weekly, aiming to increase saves + comments with a clear hook in the first line.

1.title: Optimal Posting Frequency
1.description: Your cadence is healthy and sustainable, which is a strong predictor of steady reach. Next: lock a repeatable weekly rhythm (e.g., 4â€“5 posts) and track what happens when you shift timing by 1â€“2 hours.

2.title: Comments Drive Visibility
2.description: Your best posts generate more commentsâ€”often a signal that boosts distribution. Next: add a specific question or an A/B choice prompt, and pin the best reply to keep the thread active.

insights.title: Account Insights

demoNotes.1: This page is a demo output and does not access or store real social data.
demoNotes.2: Metrics and recommendations are model-inferred, not official platform analytics.
demoNotes.3: Use as a decision reference and validate against your actual performance data.

next.title: Recommended Next Actions
next.subtitle: A focused 3-step plan mapped to the strongest signals and current constraints.
next.desc1: Standardize your posting format and cadence for the next 7 days to stabilize distribution.
next.desc2: Tighten your hook and early CTA to lift retention and drive higher-quality comments.
next.desc3: Unlock the monetization roadmap to prioritize the highest-impact revenue actions.

s1.title: Improve content consistency
s1.line2: Focus on a repeatable format and cadence for the next 7 days.

s2.title: Optimize engagement hooks
s2.line1: Increase early retention and qualified interactions.
s2.line2: Use clearer CTAs and comment prompts in the first 2 lines.

s3.title: Activate monetization signals
s3.line2: Introduce consistent callouts to offers, case studies, or lead magnets.

preview.subtitle: Preview (mock) derived from the provided link.

preview.note1: No image parsing is performed. This preview is a placeholder for UI flow.

quick.title: Quick Recommendations
quick.subtitle: Expandable suggestions based on inferred friction points.

unlock.title: Unlock official post performance
unlock.subtitle: Authorize to view platform-provided metrics and benchmarks (C mode).
unlock.note: Read-only authorization. No posting and no DM access.

health.title: Post Health Summary
health.subtitle: Inferred indicators based on publicly observable signals and patterns.
health.note: This section is inferred guidance, not official analytics.

hook.title: Hook Strength
hook.detail: Signals suggest the first-frame value proposition is present but may not be explicit enough for cold viewers.

clarity.title: Content Clarity
clarity.detail: Likely impacted by dense phrasing or competing focal points that increase cognitive load.

readability.title: Visual Readability
readability.detail: Signals suggest on-screen text hierarchy and contrast may reduce fast comprehension on mobile.

interaction.title: Interaction Cues
interaction.detail: Likely impacted by CTA placement; the cue exists but may not be strong enough to trigger comments or saves.

dropoff.title: Drop-off Risk
dropoff.detail: Signals suggest early-scrolling or swipe-away risk due to delayed payoff within the first seconds.

underperform.title: Why This Post May Underperform
underperform.subtitle: Consultant-style diagnosis based on likely constraints (non-accusatory, inferred).

reasons.1: The initial hook may not clearly communicate the value within the first visible frame.
reasons.2: Visual hierarchy may increase interpretation cost, especially on small screens.
reasons.3: Interaction prompts are present, but likely not specific enough to drive replies or saves.

rewrite.title: Actionable Rewrite Suggestions
rewrite.subtitle: Copy-ready rewrites and visual guidance based on inferred friction points.

hooks.1: If you're doing X, you're losing reach â€” here's the 10â€‘second fix.
hooks.2: Most creators miss this one signal. Fix it, and your next post performs better.
hooks.3: Before you post today, check this â€” it likely affects distribution.

ctas.1: Comment 'PLAN' and I'll share the checklist.
ctas.2: Save this for your next post â€” and tell me which part you'd improve first.

visuals.1: Keep the first on-screen line under ~7 words and lead with a single keyword.
visuals.2: Align text to one edge and increase contrast for fast scanning.
visuals.3: Use one primary focal point per frame; avoid competing callouts.

vsAvg.title: Compared to account average
vsAvg.note: Benchmarking uses your recent post baseline after authorization.

contrast.title: Content Quality vs Actual Performance
contrast.subtitle: A diagnostic contrast between inferred quality and observed outcomes
contrast.note: This suggests distribution or timing constraints rather than content quality issues.

snapshot.title: Copyable Snapshot
snapshot.subtitle: A compact summary you can paste into a doc or share with a client.
